conclusion: To determine when objects A and B are farthest apart, we need to analyze their velocity-time graphs.
Object A starts at position 0 at time t1.
Object B starts at position 0 at time t1.
Object A reaches its maximum velocity at time t2.
Object B reaches its maximum velocity at time t2.

premise: At t1, both objects are at the same position.
conclusion: At t1, the distance between objects A and B is zero.

premise: At t2, object A has reached its maximum velocity, and object B has not yet reached its maximum velocity.
conclusion: The farthest apart they are is when object A has reached its maximum velocity and object B has not yet reached its maximum velocity.

premise: At t2, object A has reached its maximum velocity, and object B has not yet reached its maximum velocity.
conclusion: Therefore, the two objects are farthest apart at t2.

premise: The two objects are farthest apart at t2.
conclusion: The two objects are farthest apart at time t2.
